feels.name: Surprise
feels.quote: He had never been insulted on his own land before, and had been inclined to regard himself as a general favorite.

feels.name: Anger
feels.quote: ‘I’m no more drunk nor you are, nor so much,’ said Dagley. ‘I can carry my liquor, an’ I know what I meean.’

feels.name: Amusement
feels.quote: Mary ended merrily, amused with the last notion.

causedBy.name: Finding the idea of Rosamond Vincy needing a handkerchief for her wedding amusing

hasObject.name: Idea of Rosamond Vincy needing a handkerchief for her wedding

Places.name: His own land
Places.description: Mr. Brooke's own land where he was insulted for the first time.

Places.name: Mr. Dagley's farmyard
Places.description: Mr. Dagley's farmyard where he felt insulted by Mr. Brooke.

Places.name: Caleb Garth's breakfast-table
Places.description: The breakfast-table where Mary Garth found the idea of Rosamond Vincy needing a handkerchief for her wedding amusing.

Events.name: Finding the idea of Rosamond Vincy needing a handkerchief for her wedding amusing
